title: Augmented Reality-Based Design Theory and Advanced Foundational Course

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental design principles and foundational understanding of scientific disciplines
context.additional_context: Learner-centered activity environment utilizing digital devices (AR-capable smart devices or VR headsets)

learning_goals: Learners can apply and explain the five core principles of design theory to real-world cases through AR content.
Learners can connect theoretical and practical approaches with over 80% accuracy when solving problems in an augmented reality-based design simulation.
Learners can propose three or more design improvement plans based on peer feedback while performing collaborative learning activities in an AR environment.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
